-produce food by land and labor
	how can laborers work? buy the land OR get contracted
-for either way laborers can work, MONEY is needed in the equation: SOMETHING THE SOUTH DOESN'T HAVE

SHARECROPPING IS WHEN CROPS WERE USED AS PAY

the problem was that sharecropping locks freedmen and others in the south
freedmen trying to farm, and once they finish a harvest they have to pay their white land owners AND their food debt, so there is no net gain for them and at the end of the year they get back where they started; no net gain / no profits
